thread.title: Etihad agrees deal with charter specialist | Buying Business Travel
thread.title_full: Etihad agrees deal with charter specialist | Buying Business Travel

title: Etihad agrees deal with charter specialist | Buying Business Travel
text:
0 comments Rob Gill Mon, 21 Sep 2015 15:25 Follow @BBT_online Etihad Airways has agreed a deal with aircraft charter specialist Chapman Freeborn to promote the airline’s The Residence and First Apartment cabins.
The partnership will see Chapman Freeborn highlight Etihad’s The Residence and apartments, which feature onboard Airbus A380s, to its clients.
The aircraft currently flies three times daily between Abu Dhabi and Heathrow, and daily from Abu Dhabi to Sydney, with an A380 also due to be deployed on Abu Dhabi- New York JFK route from December 1.
Passengers travelling with Etihad will also be able to charter private jets through Chapman Freeborn for onward travel from these A380 gateways.
Shane O’Hare, Etihad’s senior vice president marketing, said: “Chapman Freeborn’s customers can now enjoy a private jet experience on the largest passenger aircraft in the world, and the infrastructure of a world-leading airline, operating to primary gateway airports.”
Chapman Freeborn’s CEO Russi Batliwala added: “We are proud to be in partnership with Etihad Airways, offering our customers a totally unique best-in-class experience which complements our private jet service perfectly.”
